title: 111_hr3404
content: The Act titled "Emergency Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2009" extends certain unemployment benefits temporarily. The Emergency Unemployment Compensation and Additional Regular Compensation programs are extended to December 31, 2010 and January 1, 2011 respectively. The Emergency Unemployment Compensation and Additional Regular Compensation programs are extended to January 1, 2011, with amendments to specific dates in the Assistance for Unemployed Workers and Struggling Families Act. SEC. 3. ADDITIONAL EMERGENCY UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION. Section 4002 of the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2008 is amended to provide further additional emergency unemployment compensation to individuals in extended benefit periods. The additional amount is equal to 50 percent of the total regular compensation payable during the benefit year. The extended benefit period allows for additional emergency unemployment compensation to individuals, equal to 50 percent of total regular compensation during the benefit year. The maximum amount is either 20 times the individual's weekly benefit amount or 13 times the average weekly benefit amount for the benefit year. The extended benefit period provides additional emergency unemployment compensation to individuals, equal to 50% of total regular compensation during the benefit year. The maximum amount is either 20 times the individual's weekly benefit amount or 13 times the average weekly benefit amount for the benefit year. If certain conditions are met, a period with increased benefits could be in effect for a state under the Act. The text discusses rules regarding the payment of extended compensation and emergency unemployment compensation. It mentions that a state can pay extended compensation to eligible individuals after the exhaustion of emergency unemployment compensation. Additionally, it states that an individual's account can only be augmented once under this rule. The text discusses amendments to section 4002 of the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2008, regarding the effective date of the changes. The amendments apply as if included in the original enactment, with no retroactive payments before the enactment date. Section 4004(e)(1) of the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2008 is amended to include the Emergency Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2009. Additionally, extended unemployment benefits under the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act are addressed. The Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act is amended to extend benefits until June 30, 2010 and December 31, 2010. An additional $175,000,000 is appropriated for extended unemployment benefits. The American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 is amended to appropriate $807,000 to the Railroad Retirement Board for administrative expenses related to extended unemployment benefits under the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act. SEC. 6. Efficient use of the National Directory of New Hires database for federally-sponsored research assessing the effectiveness of federal programs in achieving positive labor market outcomes. Section 453 of the Social Security Act is amended to allow for evaluations of federal programs' effectiveness in achieving positive labor market outcomes, with personal identifiers provided for the purpose of conducting these evaluations.
